citation.article-title: Molecular taxonomic studies on Streptococcus uberis types I and II. Description of Streptococcus parauberis sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Streptococcus parauberis sp. nov.
Streptococcus parauberis (para.u'ber.is.Gr. pref. para alongside of or near; L. gen. n. uberis of an udder; M. L. f. n. parauberis alongside of uberis)
The following description is based on the studies of Garvie & Bramley (1979) and Collins et al. (1984).
Cells are coccoid, occurring in pairs to chains of moderate length.
Nonmotile.
On blood agar there may be a weak α-haemolysis or none.
Optimum growth temperature ca 35 to 37°C.
May or may not survive heating at 60°C for 30 min.
Grows in 4% NaCl but not 6.5% NaCl or at pH 9.6.

Acid is produced from amygdalin, arbutin, cellobiose, fructose, β-gentiobiose, galactose, glucose, lactose, maltose, mannose, mannitol, N-acetylglucosamine, ribose, salicin, sorbitol, sucrose and trehalose.
Some strains produce acid from amidon, dulcitol, inulin, melezitose, rafinose and D-tagatose.

Acid is not produced from adonitol, D-arabinose, L-arabinose, D-arabitol, L-arabitol, erythritol, D-fucose, L-fuose, glycerol, glycogen, gluconate, 2-ketogluconate, 5-ketogluconate, inositol, lyxose, melibiose, α-methyl-D-glucoside, α-methyl-D-mannoside, α-methyl-xyloside, rhamnose, sorbose, turanose, xylitol, D-xylose and L-xylose.
Aesculin is hydrolysed.
Hippurate hydrolysis is variable.
Tyrosine is not decarboxylated.
Voges Proskauer positive.
Alkaline phosphatase, arginine dehydrolase, leucine arylamidase and pyrrolidonylarylamidase produced.
Some strains produce α-galactosidase.
β-Glucuronidase is not produced. heterogeneous.
The G plus C content of DNA isSerologically 34.8 to 36.5%.
The V2 region of 16s rRNA of Strep. uberis contains the sequence UAAGUACACAUGUACUNAAUUUAAAAGGAGCAAU (positions 187 to 220), which serves to distinguish it from Strep. uberis.
Found on lips and skin of cows, in raw milk and on udder tissue.
Causes mastitis.
The type strain is NCDO 2020.
Description of the type strain
In most respects the characteristics of the type strain corresponds to that of the species.
Acid is produced from amidon, inulin, D-raffinose, and D-tagatose.
α-Galactosidase is produced and hippurate is hydrolysed.
